Sy8Q68jymclLPaTFfZVnOQ.text: This place is great for a special occasion. It is very expensive but the food is worth it. Willcome again.

bi09cRYrllx8YjW6CJV8Eg.text: I was super excited to try this place. Why not Valentine's Day? Reservation made, great. Get here, one of the hostesses refuses to seat us at a table closer to the heaters because "they have other parties coming in and it's for a four top". At the time of this post, which is 2 hours after being sat, no one has been seated at that table.   I ordered the double cut pork chops. I understand the kitchen may be backed up due to it being Valentine's Day. I ask for the pork chop to be seared with a brown crust. The server, Aaron, hesitated and responds with ok. At that point he should've made it known that the double cut pork chops are broiled and not seared. The pork chops come out and they are not brown at all. They haven't been seared at all. I let the runner know I asked for the pork chop to be seared with a brown crust. He says it's well done. Thanks, but I didn't ask for a well done pork chop.   They take the pork chop back, sear the already well done pork chop, and bring it back out. I take a couple bites and it was like eating paper. Completely ruined. I called Aaron back over to explain that I still would like the pork chop, but this one wasn't edible. Before I could explain that I just wanted the pork chop broiled less and seared more, Aaron cut me off and said "the kitchen was already pissed that you wanted it seared so they aren't going to make any substitutions because of how busy we are". Irrelevant and insensitive.   I asked for the check and Aaron brings it, along with an apology about the food stating he just knew they weren't going to change anything when he already knew what I was asking. I politely let him know he could have no possible clue what I would like because he cut me off. He takes our card and returns to let us know our meal is on him and that he again apologizes.   I'm pleased with his final solution, but not pleased with how we got there. I was hopeful about this place. I appreciate his gesture, but I do hope the service improves. The twice baked potatoes and creamed corn are phenomenal, as well as the crab mac and cheese.

yqt32DAYKxD0jnauvJuCVA.text: If you grew up in Central Phoenix as I did, then you can empathize with the fact that the 7th Street corridor is becoming more and more unrecognizable from years gone by.  What was once a landscape dotted with small to medium size businesses ranging from craft stores to equipment rental shops is now absolutely jam packed with new restaurants everywhere you look.  So many in fact that I feel like some will inevitably fail.  Its just too saturated for all of these places to survive.  Only those that can carve out the right niche and step up their game to impress the increasingly sophisticated palettes of the CenPho crowd (and deliver value) will last.  Tonight with a free cocktail coupon in hand, I met up with my Dad for dinner at S&S to see if this place has what it takes.  S&S advertises themselves as a gastropub with an emphasis on simplicity.  Where it relates to the decor, they certainly come as advertised.  Simple (but fairly elegant) wooden tables and chairs, soft lighting, and a surprisingly large restaurant (seating for almost 200) that somehow retains a fairly intimate feel.  It can be a bit noisy in here when full, but for the most part I couldn't have been more relaxed just sitting in the dining area.  The staff was super friendly and unassuming all night and served as a great compliment to the meal we had.  I've heard from a few folks who've been here for brunch, but not a soul who's done dinner here.  So I was flying blind on this one for the most part.  The waitress recommended the Sweet and Sour Meatballs as a starter.  Good call.  Admittedly the sour note wasn't very well pronounced, but the sweet part certainly was.  Sweet potato, golden raisins and a little bit of fruit (I think it was persimmon) were in this dish which acted as something of a palette cleanser to the meatballs.  For my main dish, I always have a hard time saying no to short rib and this was no different.  My short rib was also dressed with the same fruit and sweet potato as the meatballs were.  The short rib itself was cooked perfectly.  The meat pulls off easily with a fork, was super moist on the inside, and only had a light amount of seasoning.  The meat juices here are really all the flavoring this one needed.  For dessert, I got the chocolate peanut butter mousse.  Came in what looked like a mini mason jar.  It may have looked small, but wow was it dense.  Think of it as the richest most dense Reese's peanut butter cup you've ever had, and that gives you a pretty good idea.  Both my Dad and I were stuffed to the gills, but super impressed by the creativity and the approachability of the food and the great service we got from our waitress.  Total cost for an appetizer, two dinners, two desserts, three drinks (not including my free cocktail), tax and tip came out to about $80.  So about $40 for each of us.  Admittedly we went pretty nuts tonight getting the most expense entree items on the menu (most of the entree menu costs half of what ours did), but boy was it worth it.  I'll be back to check out the brunch menu at some point, and would certainly come here to try happy hour as it looks like they've got about 10 food options for $6 each during that time.  Stock & Stable has hit on a winning formula which should keep them in business for the long haul here in CenPho.  Creative food, relaxed atmosphere, good value, and unpretentious.  Pretty much everything you want in a neighborhood haunt.  Another 7th Street restaurant down.  A gazillion still to go (assuming I can keep up).

DpTNF2a3bdZd4oSb120EDg.text: We visited for a drink, with no specific dinner plans.  We enjoyed the ambiance at the bar and bartender Ben was very professional.  After reviewing the menu, we decided to order food right there and eat at the bar.  The food came FAST and was very good except that the salmon could have been warmer.... It was warm and edible, but I was looking for something closer to hot.  My spouse got the filet which was at a much better temperature.  Both dishes were delicious.  Will definitely go back again.  As an aside, our visit upstairs to Honor Amongst Thieves did not turn out so well...review on Yelp.

Also instead if us both ordering the pork chop we ordered the salmon which was also dry and not great.  So so disappointed as this has become one of our fave places to frequent. Now. Not so much. Too bad stick and stable. Sometimes change is t the right thing to do.

CbYoZRMPgUEtjiD_Fg105A.text: Last night my wife and I came back to Stock & Stable and were extremely happy with our choice.  Cocktails were some of the best we had.  We had a couple appetizers the Kung Pao Cauliflower  and pork belly steamed rolls. WOW!! These were both some of the best things we've ever put in our mouth.  We shared the special (fried chicken dinner) and it was better than any fried chicken we've ever had.  We used to visit the south frequently and have never had fried chicken this good.  After dinner we went up stairs to Honor Amongst Thieves.  The music and vibe was the best in the city.  Remind you, it is June and the place still had the energy you would expect in the non summer months.  Looking forward to going back to both of these spots!

4vQUZRURgYjobItrmYbDlw.text: Stopped in here for the first time tonight. The Kung Pao cauliflower was spectacular....I had the Bolognese, and my husband had the Rib eye....both were delicious. The beer list was good, we had a bottle of great wine, and the service was great... from the bartender (Dennis) to the manager (Jason) who came over to chat and pour us a taste of wine he thought we would enjoy. The Affogato was phenomenal, as was the recommended after dinner drink!  Great place!

JZ4ohdJJIkD9cX-kzh8vuQ.text: We were going to a concert, so went in fairly early. Our reservation was ready for us. Great food, nice variety for any palate. Service was excellent. Came by in perfect time for apps, drinks and food. Highly recommend.

I2jGpM2okfRadAUjyyRIoA.text: Went in cause I'd heard good things. Looked at the menu with my date who had been there before. Nothing looked good to either of us. She said the menu looked different than last month when she was there so we asked the waiter, Trent. He confirmed it was an all new menu. We got up and left without eating or drinking there. Somebody better fix that menu quickly cause you'll be out of business based upon what I saw of food choices.

zuP76jh32cJyxts7q8M7WA.text: Visiting from out of state on a business trip.  Saw the great reviews and tried it.  They deserve their high rating.  Great atmosphere, service, and food.  Had an excellent wedge salad with very tasty sea bass.  If I stay another night in Phoenix, I'm going back.

j2FrPemRBbMwRvGncD_40A.text: Yumm! I can't wait to go back--though my wallet might not appreciate it.   Stock and Stable is perfect for a trendy date night. So far, I have tried the Beer Butt Chicken ($16), the NY Steak ($21), and the Eggplant Parmesan ($12). While the Beer But Chicken is good, I don't exactly think it's worth the price--plus, since it's boned chicken, you might want to factor in how elegantly you can dissect boned chicken if you're out on a date. The NY Steak on the other hand, is hard to find fault in. It is well sized and comes with some amazing dipping sauces.  They have happy hour from 3-6pm, which serves as a great opportunity to try out some of their cocktails for $3 off.  My favorite drink so far is the perfectly sweet bourbon based cocktail called Church on Time ($11 Regularly/ $8 HH).  Also, if you're up for drinks after your meal, ask your waiter or bartender to show you how to get up to the speakeasy-style bar called Honor Amongst Thieves upstairs for some unique drinks.

g8pVm9_Gjd8uGbezh9d44w.text: I'll probably have to update this review the next time I eat here because I was too busy talking to pay much attention to the finer points of our dinner.  So, take this for what it's worth but I really enjoyed my meal and I will be back.  Went for dinner on a Wednesday night with a cousin from out of state.  Got there at 6:15pm, promptly greeted and seated.  We elected to sit on the patio.  Typical nice October night in Phoenix.  My first impressions, very comfortable, casual restaurant.  Since we were there so early on a week night parking wasn't an issue but I could see it being a little challenging on a busy weekend evening.  It's next block south of Culinary Dropout on 7th Street so if you've been there you know how busy this part of town can get but we didn't have a problem at all getting a space.  We get our table outside, waiter came by to get our drink orders.  Neither of us had alcohol so I didn't even look at the available choices.  I had iced tea which was a little better than normal iced tea.  My cousin ordered the 10 oz New York steak.  It looked perfectly cooked from what I saw.  He wolfed it down pretty quickly so it must have been good.  He ordered a baked potato with bacon and sourcream.  Typical side for a Minnesota guy eating a steak!  That was a sizable potato and it also looked pretty darn tasty.  I ordered the grilled cheeseburger.  It was fantastic.  Perfectly cooked to medium.  The stock and stable sauce was delicious if not a little messy.  I was too busy talking to pay attention to the flavors but it was definitely worth a repeat visit.  It was a messy eating experience but sometimes those are the best.  The fries had a special seasoning of their own which I really enjoyed but again, too busy yapping to pay attention to what it was.  Next time I'll do better.  :)  And there will be a next time.  I will be back.

f3XwHJriIHSiiEyE0grEbA.text: For seventy dollars we got two entrees, two sides(which you pay for separately), and one appetizer. I'm fine to spend $70 on dinner, but it needs to taste amazing. This place was nothing special, to the point that even if it was less expensive the food is still not great. Stock and Stable is absolutely unremarkable. I eat Paleo and was able to do so easily. My husband is gluten free and he also had no difficulties finding options. I would never choose to eat there again. It's just not that great and it's way overpriced. The staff was friendly and the restaurant is clean and nice. The music was too loud where we were sitting, but we were that obnoxious 4-top that just spoke louder to be heard. We had a fun night...and the two men in our party topped off at Zoyos down the street. So the portions were pretty small for the price in my opinion.

H-oo3HmoC1DxBLSOiFmsag.text: Great potatoes and salad good wine.   $45 filet tasted like they picked it up from Walmart or frys. Mediocre, better than outback but not by much. Cool  looking place and friendly people though.

eKVXtjubOxKHrnPgqubykQ.text: It's so hard to find a good Cuban sandwich... search no further as this has to be one of the best in the state.   Been to Miami, Puerto Rico, never Cuba, but I think I've had some of the best Cuban sandwiches. Stock compares to some of the whole in the wall spots I've been to.   I've had several other things on the menu, brought friends and family here, but I always come for the Cuban.   Place is really nice with a semi open kitchen where you can watch the magic happen. Staff has always been wonderful as well.   Now go try the Cuban!!

xp-8CSCrehL0jgZc5ZjCxg.text: The food was AMAZING! And for happy hour prices nothing beats stock and stable!! The bar tenders were so sweet and interested in the customers, it really made the experience both personal and a meal to remember! The bar tenders also helped in figuring out what type of their signature cocktail would be best for our interests not to mention all of the drink and liquor options! rBIRtF6fkte4A3HTkl6_0g.text: Came here for a drink/app while waiting on a table for the game next door. They had a good happy hour special for drinks. It was recommended we get the Kung Pao Cauliflower as an app. It's was good, not sure it's great. The outdoor patio and overall feel of the place is very nice though. 8zVd_ZWKhkv0jMeiry1zvg.text: I rate this a 3.7 rounded up to a 4. Came here the other night for happy hour. The pros: the drink selection as well as the wine selection was great! Another pro their happy hour menu items are very substantial compared to other restaurants. From the happy hour menu, we got the Kung pao cauliflower, fruitti de mare, salami board and also got other appetizers that weren't on hh: short rib dumplings and crab Mac n cheese. We ordered a lot thinking hh items would b super small but we were wrong!! They were huge portions! Everything was delicious!!! We had extra bread from the fruitti de mare and from the salami board which went amazing w the left over crab Mac n cheese! They should seriously add some bread to the Mac n cheese! Very good!  As my entree, I ordered the short rib since it was highly recommended w a side of brussels sprouts. This is where I was a bit disappointed hence the minus couple points. The short rib was very tender but soooo salty!! The first bite w the glaze made me cringe. Way too much salt in the glaze sauce. So after wiping the sauce from the short rib, it wasn't as salty but needless to say I was disappointed w this dish especially reading rave reviews on yelp. And the brussels sprouts were super salty too.   So overall the atmosphere, service and all the appetizers were amazing and worth trying.

They fryer were on too hot and it was way too crispy so it would just break off in big pieces. The chicken had a rubber texture and a distinct smell to it. Our server (Jeremy) was very attentive and friendly and knowledgeable about beer and food items. We sat on the patio and it is a very lovely experience !! I will absolutely be back!!

BjABQAlYw_JVVokeIu1BJA.text: Server was amazing - let me get that out of the way. He was great! But the food, wasn't super impressed with. I ordered the N.Y. steak and it tasted like it was burned. The parts that didn't taste burnt were way too salty. I got the steak sauce on the side, thinking it'd be like their own house made sauce. 99.9% sure it was just A1 sauce put in a small bowl. The saving graces for this place was their waitstaff, decor and their cool rooftop bar. Maybe come here for a drink but not for the food.

8oacS4PTqaPbZ9bI7J5mWA.text: Food was delicious! The service was impeccable, the atmosphere was perfect and the music choice was the coup de grace! Love this place! First timers but we will definitely be back.

IjsHhRqORSUbDP2ohKWp2g.text: Lock Stock and 2 Smoking Stables? Just kidding, this ain't no Guy Ritchie production but they do serve some tasty brunch! It wasn't too busy around noon on Sunday when we ate here which made for a pleasant and relaxing atmosphere for enjoying our meals.   After browsing through the menu I decided on the shrimp and crab benedict ($13) and a Stumptown cold brew ($5). The more I drink cold brew coffee the more I'm thinking I don't like it? Most times I've had it I encounter a bit of a sour flavor profile in the coffee which I have to mask by using multiple packets of sugar. This was the case today, as I had to ask for a basket of sweetener to make the brew more palatable for me. The sweeteners they offer here btw are honey crystals, stevia, and regular sugar (I think it was Sugar in the Raw).   I did enjoy the benedict though. It was beautifully presented, with a well balanced portion of shrimp and crab with eggs, arugula, and some thick toasted bread on the bottom instead of English muffin. The combination of the creamy Hollandaise sauce with the peppery arugula, preserved lemon, and the natural sweetness of the crab and shrimp was nice. The eggs could have been a bit more runny for my tastes but that was just a minor point.   Service was decent and we were checked up on as needed.  If I were in the area again and looking for a good place for brunch this would be a good option.

eWHWCM0j6fIp9_kayO08rg.text: My boyfriend and I tried Stock & Stable for the first time last night because we had heard from friends that it was really good, and they were definitely right. We didn't have a reservation, but were able to be seated outside right away, which was fine with me because I love sitting outside and they have a great patio. Even though it was over 100 degrees during the day yesterday, you couldn't tell here because they do a great job of keeping it cool without soaking you with misters.  Right away, we were really impressed with the draft beer list. They have a lot of lesser known options, and we were both able to try beer that we hadn't had before, recommended by our server, Andrew. Andrew was awesome, and gave us great recommendations on food as well. It was the best service we've had in a while, and he was actually honest with his opinions and told us when we asked about a menu option he didn't like :)   For dinner, my boyfriend had the Beer Butt Chicken with a side of frites which he loved, and I had the Cubano. I hadn't really thought to get that myself, but I was trusting Andrew's recommendations and I was really glad I got it. So good! The frites are really good too, and are seasoned with rosemary and parmesan.   At first, I thought this place seemed kind of expensive, but you get a ton of food for those prices, so it's really not bad. For happy hour (M-F 3-6p), they do $6 burger and fries, so I definitely want to come back for that! They also have a cocktail bar upstairs called Honor Amongst Thieves, which I can't wait to try. We don't really like cocktails so we were unsure, but Andrew let us know that they also serve all the beers that Stock & Stable has on draft.

1tCd0W_n9fRbblJy6iAWqQ.text: Stock and Stable has disappointed me yet again. I made a reservation a month ago and had to wait for 45 min due to the incompetent hostess, which sat 4 tops with two people. My reservation was at 8pm and we did not get a table until 9 pm. The hostess made an attempt to make things better by giving us a free appetizer and one drink for a table of four that ordered  appetizers, wine bottles, entrees and dessert.   I went there with a friend for happy hour and the  waiter was a bit sassy when we asked him to pre order some drinks before happy hour was over.   Then today was the last straw, a group of us showed up early and some folks decided to join us and the hostess stated they could not accommodate several additions to our party and the restaurant was basically empty. I am not sure who is running things there but customer service is not a main focus.  I called the Herb Box next door they were able to accommodate us and have a great time!!! BTW they have a great happy hour!

QA9biCrfS6zM-W7Iwopmsw.text: Great experience again at Stock & Stable. Sat at the bar and had a coctail along with Kung pao cauliflower. Cheeseburgers after that. Killer. Dessert was dandy- brownie and cheesecake. We will be back!

ilNHyH-nrSvZH4owwbTn5w.text: The service was seriously wonderful! Every two minutes someone would come by and refill our water and make sure we had what we needed which was nice. The crowd was around 40-50 year olds. The menu was not huge but what we ordered was very good! The menu prices range from $14 to around $30, with most things being around $20. We got the Cubano sandwich and the burger and also split the philly steak egg rolls. The cubano was delicious! The poem was nice and tender and then bread was really chewy and good. The burger was really good as well. It was juicy and tender and had two patties with cheese melted in between. They forgot to put the egg rolls in and brought our dinner out first so the waiter comped the appetizer and brought them out with our dinner, which was very nice. They were also great- super cheesy and beefy and came with spicy mayo to dip them in. The waiter was super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and all their drinks. Overall this place was good for a date night, just a little more expensive than I wanted!

YjtIOVuzv1UQ5QJNqESZWQ.text: Had the brunch here this morning. Everything was perfectly cooked and delicious. We had a chicken fried steak sandwich, a Belgian waffle, and a veggie hash. All were fantastic. We will definitely be coming back soon.

V7ozOPCMRhjboYUqaFqUPw.text: We had never been before, so a friend and I had to "check it out." We dropped in for a glass of wine. It was a Monday after work, so not out of control busy, but not completely dead either. Our server was very friendly and attentive. I didn't pay, so not sure about price. I'll check when I actually have to pay. There is seating at the bar. I would definitely try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Stock & Stable - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stock and Stable...red and white wine.

7DsOkoVngIi3G7Ge0Q3HFw.text: First time dinning at Stock & Stable after my son highly recommended it.  They have very interesting menu and we tried different items.  I liked the Cod in cippino sauce, very flavorful.  Service was also great!  The restaurant has a cute neighborhood vibe, cozy and fun.

uq8l6sG1dnIlf_SbY8amog.text: Truly enjoyed our meal, restaurant has a cool vide, I had the beer butt chicken with kale and my wife had NY strip steak and mashed potatoes. Both meals were delicious and cooked to perfection.   Honestly, I wasn't going to try the chicken because it just didn't  sound right but I must say it was possibly the best chicken I have ever had.  I'll come back agaib.

FiC9jPsWR7l1QPMx_L1mmw.text: Visited for lunch last Saturday. Possibly is result of being a new restaurant or perhaps the "C" team was on staff but visit was pretty disappointing. Music was way too loud. Service sub-par. 105 degrees out and had to ask twice for ice in tea. Ordered the crispy chicken sandwich -- this was a pre made chicken patty on store-bought bun. (Was told use Noble Bread on other sandwiches so expected a bit more from buns) At least the pickles were good. My friend ordered the burger--again, store-bought bun and was told could not cook beef to temperature. For a place touting 'Stock and Stable' expecting a rock-star level burger. Would have had better sandwiches from Chick-Fil-A and In-N-Out. Definitely not the quality product have come to expect based on other restaurants in the area. Hope they get it turned around as this is an interesting concept with potential to be great.

hZFwD9GaTTUR-qaT3Ap4hw.text: The value alone makes this place a great choice and hangs up on your usual avenues in dining and drinking.   The ambiance is spot on. A nice wrap around bar in the center and tables surrounding. Stop cooled down and pretty perfectly placed for a sundown drink.   Ordered a lot so try and keep up.  Port of call - perfectly balanced sweet coupe cocktail.  Dog and pony show - quasi Moscow mule sub gin. Prob the easiest to drink when it's 100* out. A table favorite. Carolina red - personal favorite. Most flavored cocktail, I could see this as a hit or miss for most. Not a new drinkers cocktail. This guy has some heart to it. Solera gomez - Least favorite. But not bad, expected a tad bit more sweetness but had a touch too much bite for the group Remember the Alamo Pitcher - They have cocktail pitchers, multiple choices too. Really great idea. Fun way to share and commune. Def jump down this road because it's served in a classy glass and packs a bunch of flavor and balance.  Roasted cauliflower - solid side dish. A good amount of salt, perfectly cooked cauli, good texture with the breadcrumbs. Could've used more of the cream sauce. That stuff was legit. Salt cod tots - A fun little fish tater tot. A tad heavy on salt but two people at the table absolutely loved these. Ate every last bite. ****Beef tongue pastrami - By far my favorite dish. It's playful, full of flavor, perfectly cooked. I could eat this guy every day and still want more. **** Potted crab - not good. Most pricey app but he least favorite. Texture was too wet and soft. Crab was lost in the mix. Wouldn't get again. But definitely didn't ruin the experience of the place.  Overall I loved stock and stable. Small personal preferences prob knocked them down the one star but I'd recommend it to anyone. I'll def be back and do another gauntlet of food and drink soon. There is still around 30 other dishes and drinks to try. See y'all soon!

mfBHRV8e_tDwAGzuRgpqOw.text: Excellent flavor. Took my family for our thanksgiving dinner and we were all very impressed:)  the restaurant is very nice and has a good ambiance and the food is delicious.

k7nUzowzuN3gST5cFerYmg.text: This place was awesome!! Great atmosphere, drinks, food and service!! Sat at the bar and the bartenders were so much fun, social and gave great recommendations. Definitely try the Whiskey Sour and the Philly Cheeze Steak Egg Rolls.

OCd5k9sKlvcS160Bh5KzYQ.text: Fantastic!! The food was incredible. The cocktails were likewise awesome. If you are looking for a "fun" cocktail this is where to come! Five stars!!

Photo of Stock & Stable - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LbLc7rBzHUGwyi4qu7Ajmw.text: I've been here on a few different occasions and have never been disappointed. If you're looking for a nice night out, and willing to spend a little more than a casual dinner, this place is great! From the cocktail and wine list to everything on the menu, my friends and I always enjoy every experience.

TvBS888qEP0doI3HPmE19g.text: Really excellent food, service and ambiance. We were with a large party for work. Everyone enjoyed themselves and the food and drink. It was a hopping place, even on a Wed at 5:30 pm. I will return.

y-VUN8etUssqkcuVaqW8fQ.text: I had several business lunches here and was completely satisfied. This was my fist dinner there on a date and was not disappointed. The food was amazing, with outstanding service and a pleasant fun nonpretentious atmosphere.

7UvONhiMFRdQRgs36ZE4NA.text: Food, drinks and services are great. My favorite restaurant and been there several times. Love their food and atmosphere. Going to have brunch soon.

sUWCtaz__Rv0dsiXPRJE-w.text: Loved this place!!! Great place to go unwind after a long work week. I felt like I was on vacation. The mirrors utensils I walked in. The live band, our great waitress Julia, great and distinct mimosas, out door patio, and delicious assortment of foods makes this place a must attend again soon. And P.S. you can watch football while you are there.

Photo of Stock & Stable - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great time, ambience and service. Went for Sunday brunch and could have stayed there all day long. Felt like I was on vacation.

R6yHlCTWzh6auUSZFGXehg.text: Fantastic new neighborhood restaurant! Happy they are finally open! Great atmosphere, positive vibe all the way around. Our waitress, Shannon, was FANTASTIC! Shout out to GM Corbin James for making it such a great experience!

LfDt537ll0LfY0pUdiPlzg.text: I really like this place.  I have had most things on the menu (I am a little sad that they took the "jalapeno" popper off) and everything is good.  The cocktails are great - I like the whiskey drinks like "Church on Time" and "Remember the Maine."  They also have solid wine and beer lists.  Apps like the kung pao cauliflower and egg rolls are awesome.  The mains are good too but I can't seem to stop ordering the burger and fries or the chicken sandwich. (that sounds lame, but they are really good)

5_IwnIIJQsEJMIUR7Vxv9w.text: This place is awesome.  They have modified their menu which makes it 10x better than it was before. Fruit cocktail and Gnudi are by far my favorite appetizers. They added a tuna sandwich to their sandwich selections which is now my favorite sandwich. To their main entrees they added swordfish and trout! Love this place.

Photo of Stock & Stable - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch specials Saturday and Sunday!!

02vJBRpknttxPHbF0E7DFQ.text: I love trying new restaurants and rarely am I disappointed. This is the first restaurant to disappoint me in a long time. I ordered the rolls as an appetizer and the beer butt chicken as an entree, because it looks good on these Yelp pictures and I love chicken. Everything was overly salty and drenched in butter/oil. I couldn't taste anything but salt. The service was sub-par. Our server really made me feel rushed and they didn't even have a line of people waiting or anything. The only reason I am giving it a 2 star instead of a 1 star is because of the ambiance. It also gave me stomach issues the next day.

BdQmMQgz0IDarVvReLvdJg.text: Came here for bunch.  Two words: vegetable hash.  Flavorful, balanced, delicious. Brunch drinks are real reasonable too.

Y-MNAKk6-teFlhuNkDUGow.text: Great Friday Night spot for the Fried Chicken !  Awesome served up on a Board with BIG biscuits - Salad and special Honey Butter ... A fave of mine and GREAT wine selection  the Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Philly Cheesesteak Rolls are the BEST

MA1PAmVuEjGCDSZvNu6jrg.text: New favorite spot. Dennis the bartender was amazing and his shirts are the best. I ordered the chicken and that boy was MOIST. We also got the pesto mac n cheese and the cubano sandwich and the cheesecake and everything was spectacular. Will definitely be coming back here frequently.

5E5WI9lMDzm5qGdZY2YaPw.text: Went to Stock & Stable on Saturday night and I'm glad we did! The Double Cut Pork Chop was amazing and I'll definitely be back for that dish again! My wife had the Trout which she thought was fantastic! The sides of Tuscan Kale and Asparagus were good, but it would be great if a side was included with the entry. Enjoyed the vodka cocktail How 'Bout Them Apples so much I had two! Recommend that the restaurant add a few more options for the wine by the glass as options were limited (3 reds to choose from). If you're a gin fan then the Say No More, Mon Amour is recommended as our friend enjoyed two of those!   An Overview: Food Quality - 5/5 Stars Service - 5/5 Stars Ambiance - 5/5 Stars Unique Cocktails - 5/5 Stars Temperature/Climate Control - 3/5 Stars (a bit warm with the front doors open in August) Wine Selection (by the glass) - 3/5 Stars Location/Parking - 5/5 (another cool Central Phoenix restaurant!) Restaurant Name Selection - 3/5 Stars (almost everyone expects a steak house, but it is not!) Value/Price - 4/5 Stars ($100 for 4 drinks, 2 entries, 2 sides, and shared 1/2 of an appetizer) Hidden Doors - 5/5 Stars (speak easy bar upstairs that is not advertised).  We stopped by for a cocktail after dinner.  We'll be back again! Recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Stock & Stable - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Double Cut Pork Chop and Asparagus! A+

85HwXIEq0FraVVDdhTPvvQ.text: Nice ambience. Stock & Stable is located in an upscale, up-and-coming area of Phoenix. If you sit outdoors on their posh patio, you'll also have a view of the Circle K gas station down the street. It's kind of unique in an endearing way. They have a great beer and wine list, though the selections for food seemed a little narrow and heavy. Restaurant was much quieter than the other places nearby. I'll definitely be back.

oqEQUaCo0ZQ7MLCVBLeigw.text: I went for Saturday Brunch. For the short review: The ambience of the outdoor patio was great! The service was awful and the food lacked flavor including their sausage gravy. I don't plan to come back.   It took over 10 minutes to order drinks after we sat down and spoke with our waiter. We ordered our food and drinks at the same time. 20+ minutes later we got our food but still no drinks! When our drinks finally arrived I realized what a ripoff their cocktails were!  $12 for a small old-fashioned champagne glass. (And this took you half an hour to make! At 1:30 pm, your place is practically empty!)  We were very specific that we wanted the bills split between the food ordered for here vs the food to go. The waiter simply split the bills by every party member.  It took another 10 minutes to pay the bill.   I have a friend that loves this place. If it weren't for the ripoff cocktail prices and the horrendous service, I could see going back. However, the service was so awful that I will probably recommend The Yard just up the street instead.

ytnnQ9H63LIbppyCfvVXuQ.text: Fabulous !! Absolutely Delish!!! Cocktails were soooo good! My sweetie had an old fashion and I had cosmos and they were PERFECT! And we are super picky. They food was beyond great!!! The phillycheese steak egg rolls and the bread rolls with the maple bourbon butter! WOW! Our server Shelby was super sweet and took great care of us. This is our new fave spot.

c29721Ju9SuLx3hwPPwP1Q.text: Best meal I've had in a long time! Amazing drinks and delicious food with such delicate flavors. You can tell that a lot of time, thought and taste went into creating the menus! We had the beet salad, sloppy Joe tostada, corn pasta, and panzanella salad. Everything was divine :) Our server Erin was awesome and gave us great recommendations, a yummy sample beer, and a tour of the bar upstairs! Can't wait to go back as soon as we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Stock & Stable - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hsVSNDoS0Mm9lqe9NjkJ6A.text: We've eaten here twice and have had drinks upstairs multiple times. The food menu is fantastic. Service has been excellent every time we have been and the drinks are great. We have done everything from a business lunch to a date night dinner to drinks with friends. Highly recommend!

Gy8N11oDoKC1tT98SS0wxg.text: Meh. Service was't too good. Server definitely made us feel like we were an inconvenience. Gee. If I didn't know better, I'd think she was paid to serve . Food was OK, but the prices are a little high. So many choices in that area I think I'll pass on Stock and Stable and try somewhere new.

tf_qb4UH1QGKtOvlfbKvEw.text: I was very excited to try Stock & Stable, however I wound up leaving disappointed.   I ordered a rib-eye and a Caesar salad, over all the food was very bland and to me not worth the money. However, the drinks were delicious.   The service was good despite having waiting 15 minutes to get our drink orders taken. Which was made up for when he asked if we had been upstairs to Honor Amongst Thieves, which was our next stop. He took us up there personally.

UUqgGYcLfgZS_BOdqz96HQ.text: My girlfriend and I were in the mood for brunch and stumbled upon this spot and were happy we did. The service was good, the atmosphere was great and the food was delicious. We did not have a single complaint. I will definitely be telling my friends about this spot.

FbkFzY2wgfQdmcnjhBa9Gg.text: Killer food. But I was severely disappointed when the bartender didn't offer water when sitting at the bar, and we had to ask after 20 min. One person wasn't drinking and she just sat there. Took forever to get a menu. I don't blame the service entirely, maybe understaffed, but without a doubt he was far nicer to the guests around my girlfriend and I. We did nothing but sit at his bar and it appeared from the first minute he wanted nothing to do with us. I've bartended and served and I hate having to give these reviews. But his service was rough. My girlfriend is much nicer than me so I didn't say anything. Again, great food. But if you're not a regular prepare for rough service.

CFWvZV0aX0dmf1iS_0i3jA.text: Had a wonderful meal with a wonderful friend. Stoped in Phoenix for a layover for a few hours. This place is just a few min from the airport so it was quick to get there. Had the short rib dumplings and the seafood linguini. Both were exquisite. Prices are in the upper teens so yeah a little on the high side but you get what you pay for. The ambiance is fantastic and the signature drinks are well crafted. We had the Moscow Myles and I was impressed with the cocktails as well as the food. I definitely recommend it.

qk9dSXWzgOvX_P9b5zbIaA.text: Stopped by for a business dinner , atmosphere was very nice and service was great.  Had the NY strip , casesar salad and egg rolls  The steak and egg rolls were amazing ! the caesar is more of a wedge salad with 3-4 big pieces of salad , needed more dressing and wasn't a typical caesar. I would say this wasn't up to par with the rest of the food. Will definitely come back to try other items on the menu.

unb5adaXzypSNjmTCPFCoQ.text: This place is esthetically pleasing. Although the food and drinks aren't quite up to par. The patio seating area is nice, when there aren't bugs flying around. Nice addition to the growing uptown Phoenix area.

P0ZATmI95dU2o4QtCJAyFg.text: Excellent food. Large Quantities. Fairly priced. Jeremy gave us excellent Service. Would definitely recommend it. 1/2 bottles of wine on Sunday-Tuesday. Yellow fin Tuna was delicious. Chocolate brownie ala mode was sinful.

v1CvFytyF_6Wcns4K_nthw.text: Came here on Valentine's Day night. Ordered the salmon and it was superb!!! Had Aaron as a waiter and while the kitchen didn't want to make additional changes to a dish ordered, Aaron came off short and cut off the person I was with as she tried to explain what she wanted. However, after the bill came Aaron came back and apologized for how he came off and made sure to rectify the situation 100%!!! I would definitely come back to this restaurant again and recommend it to friends!!! The food I had (minus the super dry pork chop the person I was with had) was amazing!!! Overall, definitely a place to put on your list to try!!!

zl_C-wXoo5nzzDZ6eV6MKw.text: N.Y.  strip steak was 75 % fat!!! My lord...I had to keep spitting out pieces of fat.  36 bucks???? It came out sliced (leaving all the juices behind)...causing the steak to get cold.  You add 2 bucks to an old fashioned because of bitters????  Who adds money for bitters??? An old fashioned is a well drink..yet not considered a well drink on happy hour..so they charge the extra money for bitters.  Never seen anyone do that.  Was our anniversary...and it was a wreck.  Overpriced....had better steak at Applebees.  With the name of stock and stable...steaks should be amazing.  Also for the price of steak..a small amount of potatoes and mushrooms shouldn't cost extra.  Total bill after 4 alcoholic beverages on happy hour..a ribeye...a NY strip..mushrooms..and potatoes was around 130 bucks...way too expensive.

xBekfDBhQrNF9ufplI6U5Q.text: Stock and Stable was so cute! Definitely perfect for a first date (I think the lighting really made it romantic) There were so many things I wanted to try but the chicken and waffle was so good! Perfect blend of savory and sweet. And the coffee cocktail? Like a dessert! If you don't like mimosas I would avoid the drink with bubbles and grapefruit. The waiter was very attentive as well!   Date Rating: 4out of 5. I love getting reverse catfished. You know when his pictures are like "eh." Then you see him in person and it's like "damn, hello"Well that's what happened with Amit. He's gonna be a doctor and I was already fantasizing about our kids with wonderful brows and dimples running around our summer home in Maine. But back to reality, we had a lot in common from our favorite foods to our philosophies on life. He has such a beautiful smile so of course I was doing everything I could to make him laugh. He was so sweet, complimenting me every other minute. He's a good kisser too. Because he's so busy he's basically a homebody but when has that ever stopped me.

photos.caption: Photo of Stock & Stable - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lpPsR9SWNfTlVGcicvGw3w.text: Ummm Hello! Why did I wait so long to visit? I literally have no excuse.  I had a fabulous time at Stock & Stable. I came with a friend for an early dinner and we loved it!! I ordered the Pesto Mac and Cheese, with an Arugula Salad. I loved them both! I took half of each home! Their happy hour at the bar is also fantastic! Cocktails are $8 during HH and I got a Mezcal drink! Staff was super friendly and our bartender had some awesome recommendations! The Pesto Mac was amazing, a great side!

uuJb4HlzukjbfcyptCS7iQ.text: Have been in before.... but decided to meet my friend here for a few cocktails. It was  Happy Hour . Excellent.  Ordered vodka/club soda. ( not the house cause it was not a good brand)... but Ketel One.  We shared a few appetizers. Very good. Nothing extraordinary. But good.  We were in deep conversation... so ordered more drinks. Bill comes.... $12 for a drink? Really??  I understand it was the house brand.... but geez.... it's still happy hour. $12 for a short glass cocktail? Absurd.  No thanks.

FtCKXyi_mxq36aGD3dXEFw.text: Not a fan.   Chicken & Waffles: They were cold when delivered and the waffles were drenched in a sweet and sour sauce and were extremely soggy. The chicken was crispy and not bad, but was cold. I really didn't care for the sauce at all.  Caesar Salad: Probably the best part of meal but was basic, not great, but not bad.   Pastrami Buns: Not a fan. The buns are supposed to be soft but they seemed old and were really hard. I took the insides out and tried to eat it with a fork- which still didn't help. They would probably be better is also served hot, on a fresh bun, with real cheese instead of yucky American cheese.   Overall I wouldn't go back. The venue is beautiful and the staff is friendly, however the food was below average and not enjoyable.

wzR0fiyWza_CD_5Liq651w.text: I had the Philly egg rolls with steak inside. Beef stroganoff and lemon blueberry cake for dessert - food was great. Good atmosphere & inexpensive. My server was nice & friend  3rd time here.  Tonight I had the stroganoff again but tried the schreiders sausages as an appetizer. - very good.  Followed up by a piece of German chocolate cake. Very good dinner.

FMbT3b9M45cbJKulwmsBxg.text: We only experienced 1 of the BIG 3 desirables: a nice atmosphere (check), a server that has a sincere interest in making your meal memorable (double uncheck), and outstanding food/drinks (uncheck). Epic fail.  We ordered two of their steak meals (Filet Mignon and ribeye). No bread was served with the meal. Everything was a la carte. Yet...when the meal came, my wife and I had one of those the-eyes-say-it-all moments, "Um....we could have easily made this ourselves. Nothing special." This included the woody textured asparagus side we ordered.  Skip this joint and find a mid-priced restaurant that at least tries to accomplish the big three. Maybe it was a completely off night(?), but we will never go again or recommend.

WHJA8MNKD8hkjV8f3SPRgw.text: This place is our "go to" whenever my husband and I want a delicious brunch.  The restaurant itself is clean, cool, and never too crowded which I love!  They have amazing cocktails, and their seafood eggs benedict steals the show.  Servers are always friendly, food comes out fast and always tastes great!

5Fzt0yzDNU5ei4tTao0_0Q.text: The Ambiance of this place was amazing! Our waiter Julian was very attentive and nice. Unfortunately, the food was not well prepared. The noodles in the beef stroganoff were still crunchy, the Halibut was overcooked & chewy, the meatball dish was so salty that we couldn't get to our water fast enough! I'm sure that they must be well known for their steaks and burgers but definitely not the other dishes on the menu! We will not try this place again with so many other good restaurants around!

YLhWCDHmcaB_1AZulg29GQ.text: Great experience for Easter brunch. Really well done kids buffet with egg decorating station. Fantastic food and wonderful service (from Julia and team!) Half off rose bottles which helped to keep the price very reasonable.  First time visiting and will definitely be back.

2fCxTki7PFqqQRmtM46QUg.text: Went there for a friends birthday party Sunday and from the door to when we got our check we were given amazing service . Everyone's food looked delicious and we had terrific service from our waiter too. Can't wait to come back next week thank you for being awesome!

snrke01oQrTE9yaYthgkNA.text: "Mike this might be the best restaurant in Arizona"  -Brent  A real attestation, from a real dude.

tAqn22pplSVqwTS9bwVWLw.text: We started next door at Bevvy but sat for a while without getting served (multiple employees walked by without acknowledging us). Walked into Stock & Stable and were greeted warmly by the hostess and brought to our table. She was fabulous- actually everyone was! Service was AMAZING at this place. Meals were gorgeous and delicious. Best stroganoff I've ever had hands down.   Great food, superb service and warm atmosphere. Will go back :)

loxrVojEtSXD2hiMXGO4XQ.text: Place is nice, very trendy and really great build out but the food isn't great...  the menu is also a little limiting.   Enjoy.

EnekYkzKUrxz-BQlZfdDzA.text: We came here for a birthday celebration. The ambiance was okay, a little dark and couldn't take a good picture. There's a bar upstairs you can go to after dinner for drinks. Maybe I'm a little old, but a DJ with no dancing was odd to me lol, especially with the type of music playing. If it was Jazz, it would make more sense.    Food: the hubby and I order the rib eye steak medium. But I didn't know medium meant burnt. I don't like my steak overcooked or too raw. My husband's words, "it's Denny's steak with a little bit of flavor for $38". We were going to take it back, but we really didn't want to be "those" people.  Good thing we shared.  The sides don't come with it. The sides were pretty good (asparagus) and for appetizers, it was one with a seafood platter, it was decent.   The best part was the company and group of friends we were with.    Not a big fan and I'm not sure I would try this place again.

uKbCLhSYbhTys0ShC5spOw.text: This has to be one of the most over priced places i have been to in while. We really went here so we could get food before going upstairs to get a drink at honor amongst thieves. It started off bad right away with the hostess and continued throughout our meal. The ribeye and sea bass were very over cooked and took 55 mins to come out to our table. Our server was very short with us and did not make us feel welcome at all. I expected more from a restaurant were i spent $150 on a Wednesday at.

QXyRNYRWJuFkKEGhj19fTg.text: Not sure where to start, as this was an early birthday celebration for me and I was excited as I had never been here. My friends made a reservation for us and we walked in and got seated right away. Started off with a bottle of bubbly, I think it was LaLuca Prosecco and that simply just hit the spot. For our appetizers we got the Kung Pao cauliflower and the Frutti Di Mare. Both were simply amazing. The cauliflower was exceptional if I may add.   For dinner we switched to a bottle of red (unfortunately don't remember the name) and for my dinner I got the the Rib Eye, and my friends got the Bolognese and the Hot fried chicken. Everything was just done tastefully and was delicious.   Server was very friendly, very attentive and took good care of us. The manager also stopped by when dropping off food and said hello. Nice staff overall.   For desert we got a piece of this crazy flavorful cheese cake that made me want more. The restaurant made it special and put a candle on it. This was an amazing   Can't wait to come back.

_kgMuJCeZzV60wT570NRsQ.text: Full disclosure, this is just a brunch review. I used to come in quite a bit for a happy hour and once for a really nice dinner, never a complaint. However, this time was a little bit different. I came in on 8/17 about 1:40pm after work. Really I just wanted a beer and a snack.  I will say I could tell right away that bartender who was also the floor server just did not seem happy. I got my water and menu right away, but Barely any eye contact, short answers, no smiles. Not welcoming at all, not what I'm used to here.  I was greeted with the brunch menu which apparently goes until 2pm. Keep in mind, it about 1:35 or 1:40 and outside of me there are 2 tables with people there and an empty bar.   She finally comes back around I ask if there's an option outside of brunch because I just wanted a snack and it was 20 minutes until brunch ended. Her reply with barely a look "No, just brunch."  Alrighty then.  Looking for something small, I opt for the biscuits and gravy. The menu describes it as sausage, fried egg, pull apart biscuit. Sounds good.  What actually arrived was a bowl with a fried egg over plenty of gravy and what I though was one biscuit and one sausage patty. Unfortunately it was actually two very large and dense biscuits. Not pull apart at all, and not very tasty.  I was looking for the sausage but did not see any until closer look, which turned out to be a very small bits mixed in the gravy, which maybe I should have expected, but did not. After a closer look, it was a lot of sausage skin and if you're lucky, maybe a quarter link ground up in the gravy.  Having to wait for her to come check on me, I took a couple of bites, ate the fried egg, got through a little bit of and biscuits, lost my appetite and was done, it just felt gross. I asked her if they forgot the sausage or if that is how it comes, she replied with absolutely no concern at all "no, just the gravy, would you like to order a side of sausage?" Ok, I was officially over it. I declined and then heard her yell to the kitchen "side of gravy!". Was that her passive aggressive way of trying to appease me? It was a huge turn off. I Tried to ask her if that was for me and said it wasn't necessary, but she didn't reply and walked away. I just wanted out, had to flag  her down for my bill, and ended up paying just over $20 for a beer, a fried egg, and a couple of bites of gravy and biscuits.  Ended up leaving the opposite of relaxed and unwound. Yay.  Note to self, avoid between 10-2 on the weekends. 2 stars for the beer and fried egg, which came as advertised. I doubt this is the new normal here, it had been a while but with the competition around, I don't think I'll be back. Why bother?

c9BVfJPn_uB6epGjoI8KrQ.text: My husband and I enjoyed brunch today at Stock and Stable. We liked the space and the service was great. Their 1/2 price bottle if Rose was a surprise and delight! While I enjoyed the Vegetable Hash, I would not recommend the Avocado Toast. It was more like cold toppings in bread.... not a fan. We will however be back to try dinner!

G9p1FXoovc51FhFGJOEvwg.text: Stopped in to the Stock & Stable for a drink after eating dinner at another local place we were anxious to try.  We were greeted politely by Ben and another tall bar back (male with dark hair).  Ordered a glass of wine and was given a decent pour.  We have both eaten and had drinks here before and enjoyed it.    This review of one star is for the other server (Red haired pregnant) working that night.  As my wife and I sat there enjoying our glass of wine we witness this server notice lipstick on a glass that she had just made a cocktail in.  Instead of dumping it and getting a new glass and remaking the drink, she used the bar rag to wipe the lipstick off.  The worse part of this was that we watched her do it twice while we had our one glass of wine....surely wasn't pleased with the sanitary conditions we were witnessing.    To make things worse, we also, in the span of one glass of wine, watched this same bartender wipe her nose across the back of her hand and then continue to make drinks, not stopping to wash her hands.    Sorry, but this could be a deal breaker for me coming back...too bad, we have always enjoyed it each time before this.

vDVG0RJVsBe_e36to1Gajw.text: I have to give the restaurant and Dennis a High Five for not only great food but also for friendliness with our group. We had reservations that we kept changing. AUQKqy9wtMkRqFD5Fp6vlQ.text: Don't do it. You'll be disappointed. Looks like a cool place but the service is absolutely terrible. We made a reservation on Saturday night at 7:30 and showed up a little early. It looked about half full but they had us wait at the bar until our reservation time, which was weird. We didn't get any service near the bar for about 10 minutes, until some server walking by asked if we were ok. We told her we were waiting for our reserved table and she left. After a few more minutes, we got sat at a table close by. We sat for 10 minutes without anyone so much as even stopping by. Two other tables were seated nearby us after we were seated, and they were both given water and service. After being ignored for about 15 minutes with no water, no server, and no contact whatsoever, we gave up and walked out. The hostess and some other employee hanging out at the front desk didn't even look up as we walked by and left. Pretty sure we're not coming back.

dGTs784pKgXBIxeCOxRA1w.text: This is officially my favorite restaurant in Phoenix! Where to start? I asked about gluten and our server, Jeremy, told me they could pretty much make anything not requiring gluten work for me. S,o no linguine, but lots of stuff on the menu is gluten-free without modification. We started with the white bean hummus which came with an delicious mountain of very fresh vegetables; the mixed carrots were like candy. This might sound like a weird complaint, but there were so many veggies that we could have used more hummus. (The hummus itself could have been a tiny bit zingier.) I'm doing whining; everything else was perfect. I had the perfectly cooked pork chop. The herby butter sauce was sinfully delicious. My husband had the Caesar salad with chicken. About the dressing he said, "It has so much garlic in it, it ought to be illegal." We shared the grilled asparagus which must have been prepared over a wood fire because it was distinctly smoky, a good thing in my view. We shared a bottle of the Ano Verde Pinot noir. It was as good as any Pinot noir I've ever had, and at $40, a very good value. And then we discovered that bottles are half off on Mondays and Tuesdays, so we only paid $20 for it! We didn't have room for dessert, so obviously we'll have to go back. (Hint to my husband) I love the decor and they were playing blues, but not so loud that we couldn't talk. Jeremy provided excellent and charming service, and then at the end of dinner, showed us upstairs to the speakeasy. Another patron told us it's crazy busy on Friday and Saturday, but it was delightful on a Monday night. And we discovered white port; who knew such a thing existed? Definitely have to go back.

oKdHI_16llly5rMlbqMGHw.text: Yum yum yum! I don't live in Phoenix but I've been trying to make my way through the new 7th St restaurants every time I visit. I ended up at Stock & Stable for Easter brunch this time, and it was such a good decision!  The restaurant was pretty busy, but we didn't have to wait for a table. We asked for a table outside and got a seat in the sun, which was okay with us (the hostess asked first). Note to S&S: on hot days, maybe don't put the silverware out until the party is seated, since it heats up and is too hot to use! In retrospect I shouldn't have been too surprised by this, but they had a special Easter brunch menu, instead of their normal brunch, which had looked amazing and that's why we picked to come here in the first place. No matter though, the Easter menu looked delicious and we settled on the salmon and Dungeness crab scramble and the Scotch egg with a side of toast.   The scrambled eggs were for me and I was so pleased with my dish. The eggs were cooked with the crab, chives, and Mascorpone, there was a sprinkle of arugula, and a good-sized piece of grilled salmon lay on top of it. When I first started eating the eggs, I had my sunglasses on and couldn't see the crab, but I did notice the crab taste. After I took my glasses off though, I realized that the egg to crab ratio was like 50-50. There were also large enough whole chunks of crab that I could pick a couple out for my husband. The eggs were creamy and the crab tasted fresh. I thought the salmon was a little overgrilled, but I like that charred grill taste so I'm not complaining. It was a nice accompaniment to the eggs, which I thought were really the star of the dish. My husband seemed happy with his meal too. The Scotch egg is a 6 minute egg wrapped in sausage, breaded and fried, over an arugula salad with grapefruit. I didn't have any of his food, but he ate the whole thing.  I'm not sure I'll ever be in a position to recommend a brunch place in Phoenix but if I am, I will for sure mention S&S. My sister-in-law says their dinner menu is great too, so hopefully I get to test that out soon!

vj_e_xIsa2df5tnrECYLFg.text: Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  Good, solid dinner.  Not all the dishes were great, but many were something we'd come back for.  I'll start with the main drawback of the night.  Busy Friday night.  It was crazy loud.  We were near-shouting the entire time.  Now on to the food.  This place is all about sharing.  We shared every dish that we ordered between the 4 of us.  Even the steaks come pre-cut for sharing purposes.  We ordered the following:  Salumi board - Probably the best dish of the night.  5 meats, 2 cheeses, Noble bread, tapenade, some pickled veggies.  It was a good size and each component was pretty darn tasty. Pork n beans - Actually green beans cooked in pork.  It was fine.  Beans were crisp and cooking in pork added some meatiness to a veggie dish. Farfalle - Slightly spicy in a seafood broth, this was maybe the second-best dish.  The spice saved it from general mediocrity. Gnudi - Decent gnudi, pretty heavy on the truffle.  These little suckers are pretty filling for their size. N.Y. Steak - A good steak for a non-steakhouse steak.  Definitely need the butter and chimichurri on the side to liven it up, but it was cooked to a good medium rare (a little closer to medium) and had decent flavor on its own. Frites - Decent fries, nothing special. Tuscan kale - Decent kale, nothing special.  So even with the shouting, we'd probably be back.  It's nice that parking seems easier here than across the street at the Yard.

aLTVaz-1GgPF2PPmqDo1lg.text: I always like to try a new restaurant for my birthday each year. This year was the big 3-0 and I was super pumped to go here. XhkGgkRC-Tb24JV4XBa9aQ.text: To be fair, I've never been one to get too excited over gastropub-style restaurants. There's already too damned many of them in Phoenix as it is - making it incredibly hard to really stand out. I think Stock and Stable makes a solid effort at trying to pull it off, but I'm not quite sure if the food is memorable enough to be called anything special.  What we have here is a highly stylized restaurant that offers a rotating menu. Yelp pictures might be misleading, as certain items, such as the Noble rolls that I saw pictured, were not available during our particular visit. That's okay though, as there were still plenty of things that we could try.  Philly cheesesteak eggrolls were interesting, although this was more along the lines of ground beef and cheese than what I'd call cheesesteak. Their salumi board, which you can obtain for five dollars less during happy hour, was a nice creative effort, filled with all kinds of meats, cheese, and the always delicious Noble bread.  For fear of going overboard, my girlfriend and I simply split a Cubano sandwich with fries, as well as a side of street corn. Neither of us were fans of the corn, which included onions, which kind of mucks up the flavor a bit too much. The fries were very crispy - some might say even too crispy, while the sandwich was a decent enough take that I'd probably recommend to others.  For dessert, we opted for their German chocolate cake, which was brought out within a matter of minutes and served warm. My girlfriend compared it to the texture of a lava cake (sans the lava). It was okay, but kind of forgettable.  Money wise, the food here is a little pricier than I originally expected - especially considering we skimped on our order by splitting one main course between two people. On the plus side, our server was very friendly and positive, checking up on us regularly.  Don't get me wrong. The food here is by no means bad. It's just really hard to differentiate it from all of the other gastropubs in Phoenix serving similar food at similar prices in similar settings.  Seen it. Done it. Over it.  But if this style of food is your thing, you're bound to have a grand ole' time here. Although it might not be for everyone, I think they're at least worth a try.

6kVCuZ87Z1gcn42AMHyxlg.text: First time stopping into Stock & Stable...and probably my last.   This is a place serving up a higher end clientele and those that enjoy meat. For us who enjoy the company of animals and prefer not to snack on them I tell ya to stay away. The options are very limited to vegetarians and even more so vegans.   Pros: -Waiter offered to make me a mocktail since I am pregnant. First waiter to do that, all others just offer me water/tea/soda.  -Hummus had a great consistency and loved the oil and herbs that topped it. I didn't however enjoy the pita, it was cooked to be pita chips some areas were burnt. I would have preferred soft pita.  -Favorite thing about this entire place is there dessert. LEMON bars are to die for...and just the perfect portion.   Cons: -Limited menu for vegetarians -Cesar salad was dry and the dressing seemed odd when I ordered a side of it.  -Street corn was good but they covered it in an avocado paste that seemed artificial and was just too much.

11a1M3wzi7zuFSfm1boVvg.text: This is a hidden/tucked-away gem of Phoenix, definitely perfect for a date night. I booked a table for us two on OpenTable and surprisingly they had fairly open availability on a Saturday night. He picked out the spot and so glad he did- it was probably one of the best meals I've ever eaten in the Valley. And the romantic decor/restaurant layout made it better. Like a well-decorated basement of a multi-level home that opens to the great outdoors. I looked ahead of time online to peruse the menu and discovered they had recently changed their menu. A few things I was hoping to try disappeared!   The staff were nice, but a little space-headed unfortunately. It probably was a good 10-15 minutes before our waiter came by the table, greeted us and served us water. At this point we both knew to order food and drinks at the same time (and to err on the side of caution if they kept forgetting about us). We wanted elote first (a staple in our dining if possible) and we probably could've eaten two sides of it- absolutely delicious. It came out with our main dishes though and drinks which was a little odd/surprising. And the drinks came out with dinner which didn't make sense at all. Perhaps it was an off night for service for the restaurant. My gin drink was good, but not really worth the $12. The lavender ice cube was cute though.  I saw stroganoff and my heart skipped a beat because not many places offer that on their menu. The flavors reminded me of a childhood recipe, amplified x1000. Umami, rich and filling- do not pass on ordering this if it's available. His short rib and potatoes were good, but not nearly as good as my main plate. As we winded down our main meals, a few of the desserts passed by and we went with the cheesecake. I'm not a huge fancy cheesecake fan (my go to at The Factory is vanilla) but this had me wrapped around its finger.   Definitely worth coming back for another fun date night. If you stay later, ask your server to take you upstairs the back way to Honor Amongst Thieves.

photos.caption: Photo of Stock & Stable - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gin drink - the ice cube is indeed blue thanks to minced lavender
Photo of Stock & Stable - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stroganoff

eo4c-jZ3WQMc82FJYzgGAw.text: My husband's birthday dinner at Stock & Stable was a success! We had made reservations online & were seated immediately upon arrival. The servers were friendly and attentive throughout the evening & helped us out with recommendations / questions.  The 4 of us started off with the Crab Cakes. I actually hadn't checked any photos or reviews on Yelp prior to us dining here, so I'm not sure if it has been mentioned; this appetizer actually only comes with a single crab cake. For 4 people, it probably wasn't the best choice. The Crab Cake itself, however was good, it was crunchy & flavorful. I personally thought the red curry was a bit too spicy with the crab but others liked it.  For entrees, I got the Butter Butt Chicken (with whipped potatoes), my mother in law got the Pork Chops (with ricotta, spinach, pomodoro), and my husband & his dad got the special which was a filet with potato on bottom (I can't remember exactly what it was called). The chicken was super tender & juicy and fell right off the bone, I ate all of it! I wasn't a huge fan of the whipped potatoes as they were a little bland. Everyone else also enjoyed their meals! They were a good size & filling.  Birthday's can't be complete without some dessert! We split the cheesecake & chocolate brownie with ice cream. Again both were good, the brownie was super chocolate-y & rich and the cheesecake was soft and fluffy. Overall, an enjoyable experience for dinner. I would return to try out other menu options!

GsR3HgC92woZgp9odrZi7Q.text: Yum! I've eaten here twice and just love this place. The Salumi Board is a no-brainer to start. The ambiance is great, servers are very personable. Tonight we had Trent and want to be his best friend. Will be back again.

h3Xj5zUwM_6v-D9WjS7mzA.text: I came here on a Saturday night around 7pm and the inside of the restaurant was packed. However, they were able to seat us immediately in the outside patio. Luckily they had very strong heaters for a chilly night!   FOOD: We ordered the linguine pasta, the chicken and dumplings, and chocolate chip brownie for dessert. The main entrees were decent- nothing extremely memorable. The portions seemed too small as my date and I both were not full after eating both pasta dishes. We ended up ordering the brownie for dessert and it was the BEST BROWNIE EVER! It was melty and warm in the middle and came with vanilla ice cream on top! We INHALED it! Overall, I would have given stock and stable a 4/5 for food and ambience, but I am taking off a star for service.   SERVICE: Their service was so slow. One waiter asked us 2 different times if he could get us anything (once I asked for large plates to share, and the next time I asked for the dessert menu). Both times, he did not follow through and we ended up having to ask another waiter walking around. We had to wait a long time for the dessert menu but luckily that brownie made up for everything and was to die for!)

-0RLjBi1VjT5Qbce9cOfuw.text: Made reservations today for this awesome place. We were lucky to have Jeremy as our server. He was so attentive and cool.   Never having been here before, it was exciting to decide on what to eat and drink. The golden heart was so delicious. The philly egg rolls were not what I was expecting. It was way better than I ever thought they would be. My short rib with fingerling potatoes was perfection. Cut it with a fork. Hubby had the Stroganoff and the bite I had was superb. He sure did finished it to the last drop.   They were on the AZ Restaurant Week menu and it was awesome.   We can not wait to return. The upstairs bar opens at 6 pm so we have to come back and enjoy that. But our experience was definitely worth every second. Yummmmm.

I tried the Thai Salad (could be wrong in name), I was pretty unsure because the description was not what I expected nor did it looked like I expected. Once I tried it was another story, it was delicious! Definitely will come back and try the same food item.

Kl7955vA4s0gLRDuruP0bQ.text: (Lyrics - Joan Jett - I Love Rock N' Roll)  I kept on staring there right down by 7th Street I knew I must a been a foodie scene The drinks were coming strong Yelping my favorite songs  And I could tell it wouldn't be long Till I would try  it, Yelp it And I could tell it wouldn't be long Till I I would try it, Yelp it, singing  I love Stock and Stable So put another bite in my palate, baby I love Stock and Stable So come and bring your appetite and eat with me  Stock & Stable has a nice vibe and view.  I've been eyeing this place from the road every time I pass and finally just gave in to check them out!  A lot of wood as I recall and not a bad thing.  Almost vintage to some point, but wood....    We started out with some cocktails and to my surprise they have a bar upstairs.  A some what of a speak easy of sorts since you have to be brought up by your server.  Definitely something I gotta check out next time.    For our food we started with their Pork Belly Buns; pork belly marinated in a sort of Korean BBQ sauce with pickles and sprouts.  Served like a triplet of tacos, I would say you should eat quickly so that the sauce doesn't make the buns soggy.  Moreover, the bun was sweet and sour because of the BBQ while the pickle provided a much needed texture.  I would say another element of texture would have been nice like cabbage or something.  For our entree I ordered the Bolognese and my partner went for their Linguine.  I really enjoyed my pasta dish since it was large flat noodles which paired well with the meat sauce.  I was able to scoop up both was ease and lay some on my toast it came along with.  The sauce itself was thick and slightly sweet, but just perfect to my palate.  The Linguine my partner said was good, but was a lot of broth and little substance.  She brought some broth home just to finish off with some bread.   In the end, Stock and Stable is located in the heart of PHX's next restaurant hot bed.  It's definitely worth the visit for drinks and a revisit for me to check out the "upstairs" bar! - Enjoy!

p9I6WKdmVO4BUu5_Y0sWkA.text: First time here  Service was on point!  Asked for an entree suggestion as I was deciding between three different ones.  The server said all three were good, but brought me the beef stroganoff.  Excellent suggestion. It was made from short ribs. Pasta tasted homemade.  We also had the pumpkin cheesecake and French pressed coffee.  So good.   I would definitely return.  Restaurant was clean. Decor was cute.

photos.caption: Photo of Stock & Stable - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2KLBqU7udtuWjF42b-B-NQ.text: We had reservations for Saturday night and were seated quickly but it took 10 minutes for our waitress to come over and then throughout the whole evening it became a joke at our table that we needed to anticipate what we were going to need 20 minutes from now because it took forever to get her to come back and then forever for what we asked for to show up.   The Salumi Board was really good but that is where it ended. I tried the Stroganoff and was less than enthused. It lacked flavor and that combined with the poor service made for a less than great food experience.

sodzya3lFmY3yLPKi52Bnw.text: After getting a few recommendations from friends, my boyfriend and I finally tried Stock & Stable and it happened to be Restaurant Week! We totally forgot that was going on, so that was really lucky :)  For the starters, we chose the Kung Pao Cauliflower and the Frutti Di Mare. Even if you're not a fan of cauliflower, I highly recommend the Kung Pao! We both loved it; the sauce was delicious and so were all the toppings. I don't like cauliflower that much, and I've had cauliflower nachos at other places where it's like, "okay, this is still just cauliflower with a tiny bit more flavor..." lol, but this one is really crispy and is a great sub for meat. The Frutti Di Mare was awesome too; the bread was a bit charred for my taste but the seafood was pretty tasty!   Then, for dinner, we did the Beer Butt Chicken and the Short Rib. I thought both were good; I'm not super into the "homestyle" type of foods as much and that's more what they were. Still, I loved the fingerling potatoes that were served with the short rib and everything was well-made and great quality! :)  Dessert with Restaurant Week were Cheesecake Bites - one regular cheesecake covered in chocolate, and one pumpkin cheesecake covered in white chocolate. Those were delicious! I think we'll for sure go back here again. The inside is also beautiful and a lovely place to be when it's nice out and they have the windows open!

r2yh0YOkjCrwYiMFUjRM5g.text: I hate to say his but I forgot to take pictures of all the food we ate :(. This place is always consistently fantastic. We had the beer can chicken yummy, the charcuterie board so good. We had the salmon wish was very fresh. The beef stroganoff is always a favorite. I had the noble rolls for the first time And omg the maple butter is to die for, so good u can lather me up in it lol. The asparagus and the loaded mashed potatoes are yummy. Really nothing we ate was bad.   Ps they have the best cubano in all of Phoenix

02S7UCGVk1yX0fCsl0IEQw.text: My wife and I recently stopped at Stock & Stable for a quick dinner. I had the Beer Butt Chicken which was rich and tender with crisp skin and sat on a savory bed of creamy mashed potatoes. Delicious and addictive!

oo_vftq4BLI4eyOpEUAJlw.text: Awesome service awesome food! I started upstairs at HAT.. very disappointed. So glad I decided to stick around and head downstairs. Such great service and even better food. I had a Tom Collins (gin) and I dig the restaurant week menu. Philly cheesesteak rolls and medium steak topped off with a cookie. My taste buds feel like they just kissed a prince. Prince Harry to be exact (sorry Megan). The service was magnificent, the food was just spectacular. I'll definitely be back... most likely tomorrow.

2cUGpSjBVk7uucGzTUnqtw.text: Great atmosphere for an after-work happy hour.   The appetizers are great for sharing, and they have a nice selection of drinks available depending on your imbibe of choice. I opted for gin, so I enjoyed their Moscow mule and the "sloe down" gin drink. Both yummy and well-made. Our waiter was great and very attentive, and the food tasted great.   My only issue is the pricing, as it's a bit on the expensive side (but you get what you pay for!)

photos.caption: Photo of Stock & Stable - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FFvHlIZB26Z-Aw9eCpe_Ng.text: YOU MUST EAT HERE. My friends and I went for restaurant week, I heard the place was good, but all expectations were exceeded!  The drink selection is great, we started with some wine. For the first course, we got the cauliflower dish which was unbelievable, the frutti de mare, and I got the arugula salad. All were delicious - and very filling. When we finished course one I was already worried I wouldn't have room for the entree. My two friends got the beer butt chicken and I got the salmon. Both were incredible, especially the chicken. It was super juicy and the seasoning was insane. The salmon was also delicious, one of the best salmon dishes I've had.  For dessert, we asked for a to-go container and ended up enjoying the chocolate cake at a later time.  I believe all the items we got are on the regular (non restaurant week) menu. This place is definitely on the pricey side, but if you are willing to splurge a bit you definitely won't be sorry. The service is also excellent, and the patio is super comfy.

dnYOXOsjCsmodRE3UgYbfA.text: The service was really great and the prices are not bad for such a nice restaurant! Our waiter (I forget his name but he was very flamboyant and sweet) got me a free dessert (a yummy warm brownie) for my birthday even though it was a week away and was super personable! The fries my friend got with his burger were sooo yummy but my bolognese pasta was even better! My friend works for the same company that owns it and they gave us a discount as well. Very great service!

qUTWOuWXG6soEmYiNZ4rug.text: Gonna make this review short and sweet. The amount of food you get does not match the amount of money you spend. 2 salads, one with salmon, a side of mashed potatoes and 1 beer totaled $47 before tip.   We are not cheap people but I'm tired of these trendy restaurants popping up in central Phoenix with these petite portions. They will not get our money again.

sf2iTUhn_43NAb2WAuLpEQ.text: Decor/ambiance is very nice. Most of the things we ordered were pretty good, but I feel I have to rate it overall as 3 stars given the price.    Good/not bad orders: rib eye (10 oz, tasted like beef teriyaki), short ribs, chicken and mint salad, ny strip (came with a weird spicy green sauce on the side that was kind of unnecessary), side of mashed potatoes (smaller than you would think, but it's pretty rich/creamy/cheesy so it's satisfying. Just overpriced), brussels sprouts.  Less good orders: The fish of the day (Chilean sea bass) was overcooked and a little tough on the outside. Also its description includes baby clams and shrimp, but I think it's pureed into tomato sauce because there were definitely no clams or shrimps on my plate. The Caesar salad was overpriced, the only good thing is that it comes with avocado toast. Would recommend the chicken and mint salad over it.   It looks like this place has good happy hour deals that would make it worth coming here, but otherwise I think I could find food that tastes just as good for a better price elsewhere.

lKuOMI0FmmXaiuq9rvI7Rg.text: They have a decent happy hour with more than one wine to choose from.  The burger and fries for $6 is a great deal.  The menu tries too hard to be trendy but the staff is super friendly and efficient.
